org.raistlic.common.taskqueue

Interface TaskQueue


  • public interface TaskQueue
    This interface defines the API of a single thread runnable queue implementation.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  TaskQueue.Controller
      The controller that holds the instance of the task queue, and controls its life cycle.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isRunning()
      The method returns whether the task queue is running.
      boolean isTaskExecutionThread()
      The method returns whether the current (calling) thread is the task queue thread.
      void schedule(java.lang.Runnable task)
      The method submits a runnable task into the task queue to be executed.
      <R> Promise<R> schedule(Task<R> task)
      The method submits a runnable task that has a returned result when executed into the queue, and returns a Promise that references to the task.
      <R> R scheduleAndWait(Task<R> task)
      The method submits the task into the task queue, waits until it's executed, and returns the returned execution result.
      <R> R scheduleAndWait(Task<R> task, long timeout, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
      The method submits the task into the task queue, waits up to timeout for it to be executed, and returns the returned execution result.

    • Method Detail

      • schedule

        void schedule(java.lang.Runnable task)
       throws InvalidParameterException,
              InvalidContextException
        The method submits a runnable task into the task queue to be executed.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to be scheduled, cannot be null.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - when task is null.
        InvalidContextException - if the task queue is not running.

      • schedule

        <R> Promise<R> schedule(Task<R> task)
                 throws InvalidParameterException,
                        InvalidContextException
        The method submits a runnable task that has a returned result when executed into the queue, and returns a Promise that references to the task.
        Type Parameters:
        R - the actual return type of the Task's run method.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to be scheduled, cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the promise that references the scheduled task.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - when task is null.
        InvalidContextException - if the task queue is not running.

      • scheduleAndWait

        <R> R scheduleAndWait(Task<R> task)
               throws InvalidParameterException,
                      InvalidContextException,
                      InvalidContextException,
                      TaskExecutionException,
                      java.lang.InterruptedException
        The method submits the task into the task queue, waits until it's executed, and returns the returned execution result.
        Type Parameters:
        R - the actual return type of the Task's run method.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to execute, cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the task 's execution result.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - when task is null.
        InvalidContextException - if the task queue is not running.
        InvalidContextException - when the method is called within the task queue execution thread, see isTaskExecutionThread() .
        TaskExecutionException - if the task's Callable.call() method throws exception.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the current calling thread is interrupted when waiting for the task to be executed.

      • scheduleAndWait

        <R> R scheduleAndWait(Task<R> task,
                      long timeout,
                      java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
               throws InvalidParameterException,
                      InvalidContextException,
                      InvalidContextException,
                      TaskExecutionException,
                      java.lang.InterruptedException,
                      java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        The method submits the task into the task queue, waits up to timeout for it to be executed, and returns the returned execution result.
        Type Parameters:
        R - the actual return type of the Task's run method.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to execute, cannot be null.
        timeout - the max amount of time that calling thread is going to wait for the task to be executed, cannot be negative.
        timeUnit - the unit of the timeout .
        Returns:
        the task 's execution result.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - when task is null, or when timeout is less than 0 .
        InvalidContextException - if the task queue is not running.
        InvalidContextException - when the method is called within the task queue execution thread, see isTaskExecutionThread() .
        TaskExecutionException - if the task's Callable.call() method throws exception.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the current calling thread is interrupted when waiting for the task to be executed.
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - if the task is not executed within timeout .

      • isTaskExecutionThread

        boolean isTaskExecutionThread()
                       throws InvalidContextException
        The method returns whether the current (calling) thread is the task queue thread.
        Returns:
        true if the current (calling) thread is the task queue thread.
        Throws:
        InvalidContextException - if the task queue is not running.

      • isRunning

        boolean isRunning()
        The method returns whether the task queue is running. Attempting to submit a task to a not running task queue will cause IllegalStateException .
        Returns:
        true if the task queue is running.
